result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael D Harpe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and IS Eligible for Substance Abuse Program. Sentence credit of 204 days were granted.

superMiscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to 10 Poronography Image surcharges. Balance of court costs to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.

No unsupervised contact with any minors under the age of 18. No use or possession of any type of pornography. No Use or Possession of computer technology (Internet) without exclusive permission of agent. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. 
Comply with Sex Offender treatment. Must register as a sex offender. Forfeiture of seized items. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

pretrial incarceration sheet
character letter from Defendant's wife

Defendant Michael D Harpe in court with Attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Ritter makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

6 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 204 days)
  -  3 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  3 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON:  
____No Use or Possession of any type of pornography 
____No Use or Possession of computer technology (internet) without exclusive permission of agent
____No unsupervised contact with: any minors under the age of 18
____Sex offender treatment
____Must register as a sex offender
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done
____Forfeiture of seized items 

PORNOGRAPHY IMAGE SURCHARGE:  $500.00 x 10 images = $5,000.00 (to be paid out of bail money posted)

COSTS:  $268.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision)

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Filed.
Sentencing hearing on March 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Michael D Harpe in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.Defendant enters guilty plea to count # 1. Court performs plea colloquy and finds defendant guilty of count #1. Counts #2-10 are dismissed and read in. PSI ordered. Atty Ritter requests additional huber release hours. State takes no position. Court authorizes huber to set additional family care hours at their discretion.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
